intro: Tithymalus promecocarpus, commonly known as the golden cupflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves that are hairy and often have a slightly serrated edge. Its fruit is a small, dry capsule that splits open to release tiny seeds. Tithymalus promecocarpus thrives in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and prairies.
